children.name: Apache Ant
children.description: Build process management with XML.

children.name: cglib
children.description: Bytecode generation library.

children.name: GlassFish
children.description: Application server and reference implementation for Java EE sponsored by Oracle.

children.name: Hudson
children.description: Continuous integration server still in active development.

children.name: JavaServer Faces
children.description: Oracle's open-source implementation of the JSF standard, Mojarra.

children.name: JavaServer Pages
children.description: Common templating for websites with custom tag libraries.

children.name: Apache Maven
children.description: Declarative build and dependency management which favors convention over configuration. It might be preferable to Apache Ant which uses a rather procedural approach and can be difficult to maintain.

children.name: Bazel
children.description: Build tool from Google that builds code quickly and reliably.

children.name: Gradle
children.description: Incremental builds which are programmed via Groovy instead of declaring XML. Works well with Maven's dependency management.

children.name: ASM
children.description: All purpose, low level, bytecode manipulation and analysis.

children.name: Byte Buddy
children.description: Further simplifies bytecode generation with a fluent API.

children.name: Byteman
children.description: Manipulate bytecode at runtime via DSL (rules) mainly for testing/troubleshooting.

children.name: Javassist
children.description: Tries to simplify the editing of bytecode.

children.name: Apache Aurora
children.description: Apache Aurora is a Mesos framework for long-running services and cron jobs.

children.name: Singularity
children.description: Singularity is a Mesos framework that makes deployment and operations easy. It supports web services, background workers, scheduled jobs, and one-off tasks.

children.name: Checker Framework
children.description: Enhances Javaâ€™s type system to make it more powerful and useful.

children.name: Checkstyle
children.description: Static analysis of coding conventions and standards.

children.name: Error Prone
children.description: Catches common programming mistakes as compile-time errors.

children.name: FindBugs
children.description: Static analysis of bytecode to find potential bugs.

children.name: jQAssistant
children.description: Static code analysis with Neo4J-based query language.

children.name: PMD
children.description: Source code analysis for finding bad coding practices.

children.name: SonarQube
children.description: Integrates other analysis components via plugins and provides an overview of the metrics over time.

children.name: ANTLR
children.description: Complex full-featured framework for top-down parsing.

children.name: JavaCC
children.description: More specific and slightly easier to learn. Has syntactic lookahead.

children.name: config
children.description: Configuration library for JVM languages.

children.name: owner
children.description: Reduces boilerplate of properties.

children.name: Choco
children.description: Off-the-shelf constraint satisfaction problem solver, which uses constraint programming techniques.

children.name: JaCoP
children.description: Includes an interface for the FlatZinc language, enabling it to execute MiniZinc models.

children.name: OptaPlanner
children.description: Business planning and resource scheduling optimization solver.

children.name: Sat4J
children.description: State-of-the-art SAT solver for boolean and optimization problems.

children.name: Bamboo
children.description: Atlassian's solution with good integration of their other products. You can either apply for an open-source license or buy it.

children.name: CircleCI
children.description: Hosted service with a free trial.

children.name: Codeship
children.description: Hosted services with a limited free plan.

children.name: fabric8
children.description: Integration platform for containers.

children.name: Go
children.description: ThoughtWork's open-source solution.

children.name: Jenkins
children.description: Provides server-based deployment services.

children.name: TeamCity
children.description: JetBrain's CI solution with a free version.

children.name: Travis
children.description: Hosted service often used for open-source projects.

children.name: uniVocity-parsers
children.description: One of the fastest and most feature-complete CSV. Also comes with parsers for TSV and fixed width records.

children.name: Apache Phoenix
children.description: High performance relational database layer over HBase for low latency applications.

children.name: Crate
children.description: Distributed data store that implements data synchronization, sharding, scaling, and replication. In addition, it provides a SQL-based syntax to execute queries across a cluster.

children.name: Flyway
children.description: Simple database migration tool.

children.name: H2
children.description: Small SQL Database notable for its in-memory functionality.

children.name: HikariCP
children.description: High performance JDBC connection pool.

children.name: JDBI
children.description: Convenient abstraction of JDBC.

children.name: jOOQ
children.description: Generates typesafe code based on SQL schema.

children.name: Liquibase
children.description: Database-independent library for tracking, managing and applying database schema changes.

children.name: MapDB
children.description: Embedded database engine that provides concurrent collections backed on disk or in off-heap memory.

children.name: Presto
children.description: Distributed SQL query engine for big data.

children.name: Querydsl
children.description: Typesafe unified queries.

children.name: Apache Parquet
children.description: Columnar storage format based on assembly algorithms from the Dremel paper by Google.

children.name: Protobuf
children.description: Google's data interchange format.

children.name: SBE
children.description: Simple Binary Encoding, one of the fastest message formats around.

children.name: Wire
children.description: Clean, lightweight protocol buffers.

children.name: Joda-Time
children.description: De facto standard date/time-library before Java 8.

children.name: Time4J
children.description: Advanced date and time library.

children.name: Inversion of Control
children.description: paradigm.*

children.name: Apache DeltaSpike
children.description: CDI extension framework.

children.name: Dagger2
children.description: Compile-time injection framework without reflection.

children.name: Guice
children.description: Lightweight but powerful framework that completes Dagger.

children.name: HK2
children.description: Light-weight and dynamic dependency injection framework.

children.name: ADT4J
children.description: JSR-269 code generator for algebraic data types.

children.name: AspectJ
children.description: Seamless aspect-oriented programming extension.

children.name: Auto
children.description: Collection of source code generators.

children.name: DCEVM
children.description: Modification of the JVM that allows unlimited redefinition of loaded classes at runtime.

children.name: HotswapAgent
children.description: Unlimited runtime class and resource redefinition.

children.name: Immutables
children.description: Scala-like case classes.

children.name: JHipster
children.description: Yeoman source code generator to create applications based on Spring Boot and AngularJS.

children.name: JRebel
children.description: Commercial software that instantly reloads code and configuration changes without redeploys.

children.name: Lombok
children.description: Code-generator which aims to reduce the verbosity.

children.name: Spring Loaded
children.description: Class reloading agent.

children.name: vert.x
children.description: Polyglot event-driven application framework.

children.name: Akka
children.description: Toolkit and runtime for building concurrent, distributed, and fault tolerant event-driven applications.

children.name: Apache Storm
children.description: Realtime computation system.

children.name: Apache ZooKeeper
children.description: Coordination service with distributed configuration, synchronization, and naming registry for large distributed systems.

children.name: Hazelcast
children.description: Highly scalable in-memory datagrid.

children.name: Hystrix
children.description: Provides latency and fault tolerance.

children.name: JGroups
children.description: Toolkit for reliable messaging and creating clusters.

children.name: Orbit
children.description: Virtual Actors, adding another level of abstraction to traditional actors.

children.name: Quasar
children.description: Lightweight threads and actors for the JVM.

children.name: Apache Cassandra
children.description: Column-oriented and providing high availability with no single point of failure.

children.name: Apache HBase
children.description: Hadoop database for big data.

children.name: Druid
children.description: Real-time and historical OLAP data store that excel at aggregation and approximation queries.

children.name: Infinispan
children.description: Highly concurrent key/value datastore used for caching.

children.name: Bintray
children.description: Version control for binaries which handles the publishing. Can also be used with Maven or Gradle and has a free plan for open-source software or several business plans.

children.name: Capsule
children.description: Simple and powerful packaging and deployment. A fat JAR on steroids or a "Docker for Java" that supports JVM-optimized containers.

children.name: Central Repository
children.description: Largest binary component repository available as a free service to the open-source community. Default used by Apache Maven and available in all other build tools.

children.name: IzPack
children.description: Setup authoring tool for cross-platform deployments.

children.name: JitPack
children.description: Easy to use package repository for GitHub. Builds Maven/Gradle projects on demand and publishes ready-to-use packages.

children.name: Launch4j
children.description: Wraps JARs in lightweight and native Windows executables.

children.name: Nexus
children.description: Binary management with proxy and caching capabilities.

children.name: packr
children.description: Packs JARs, assets and the JVM for native distribution on Windows, Linux and Mac OS X.

children.name: Apache POI
children.description: Supports OOXML (XLSX, DOCX, PPTX) as well as OLE2 (XLS, DOC or PPT).

children.name: documents4j
children.description: API for document format conversion using third-party converters such as MS Word.

children.name: jOpenDocument
children.description: Processes the OpenDocument format.

children.name: Cyclops
children.description: Monad and stream utilities, comprehensions, pattern matching, trampolines and much more.

children.name: Fugue
children.description: Functional extensions to Guava.

children.name: Functional Java
children.description: Implements numerous basic and advanced programming abstractions that assist composition-oriented development.

children.name: Javaslang
children.description: Functional component library that provides persistent data types and functional control structures.

children.name: jOOÎ»
children.description: Extension to Java 8 which aims to fix gaps in lambda, providing numerous missing types and a rich set of sequential Stream API additions.

children.name: jMonkeyEngine
children.description: Game engine for modern 3D development.

children.name: libGDX
children.description: All-round cross-platform, high-level framework.

children.name: LWJGL
children.description: Robust framework that abstracts libraries like OpenGL/CL/AL.

children.name: JavaFX
children.description: The successor of Swing.

children.name: Scene Builder
children.description: Visual layout tool for JavaFX applications.

children.name: Agrona
children.description: Data structures and utility methods that are common in high-performance applications.

children.name: Disruptor
children.description: Inter-thread messaging library.

children.name: fastutil
children.description: Fast and compact type-specific collections.

children.name: GS Collections
children.description: Collection framework inspired by Smalltalk.

children.name: HPPC
children.description: Primitive collections.

children.name: Javolution
children.description: Library for real-time and embedded systems.

children.name: JCTools
children.description: Concurrency tools currently missing from the JDK.

children.name: Koloboke
children.description: Hash sets and hash maps.

children.name: Trove
children.description: Primitive collections.

children.name: Eclipse
children.description: Established, open-souce project with support for lots of plugins and languages.

children.name: IntelliJ IDEA
children.description: Supports a lot of JVM languages and provides good options for Android development. The commercial edition targets the enterprise sector.

children.name: NetBeans
children.description: Provides integration for several Java SE and EE features from database access to HTML5.

children.name: Imgscalr
children.description: Simple and efficient hardware-accelerated image-scaling library implemented in pure Java 2D.

children.name: Picasso
children.description: Image downloading and caching library for Android.

children.description: Thumbnailator is a high-quality thumbnail generation library for Java.

children.name: ZXing
children.description: Multi-format 1D/2D barcode image processing library.

children.name: Jackson
children.description: Similar to GSON but has performance gains if you need to instantiate the library more often.

children.name: LoganSquare
children.description: JSON parsing and serializing library based on Jackson's streaming API. Outpeforms GSON & Jackson's library.

children.description: Early access releases of JDK 9.

children.description: Open-source implementation.

children.description: Statically typed programming language that fuses the object - oriented model and functional programming ideas.

children.description: Optionally typed and dynamic language, with static-typing and static compilation capabilities. Currently an incubating Apache project

children.name: Ceylon
children.description: Statically typed object-oriented language developed by RedHat.

children.name: Kotlin
children.description: JetBrain's statically typed programming language for the JVM, Android and the browser.

children.name: kibana
